Description: Ostracon, section (three fragments joined) of the rim of a buff-coloured pottery dish, shallow with slightly flaring sides and turned rim, the fabric is relatively fine, covered with a burnished cream-orange slip, with remains of two columns of Coptic text written in black ink, separated by drawn lines, on the interior, the first column comprises nine and the second eight lines of text, containing multiplication tables.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.53)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.259-60)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (89508) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/89508)
Condition: fair (incomplete, three fragments joined - text worn)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 316 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 22 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
